meanings.definition: A straight line or plane that touches a curve or curved surface at a point but does not intersect it.
meanings.sent1: The tangent of the circle just grazed the edge.
meanings.sent2: She drew a tangent to the curve to show the point of contact.
meanings.sent3: The tangent decided to take a quick break from touching the curve.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like tangents, touching briefly but never merging.
meanings.sent5: The tangent gently kissed the curve before moving away.

meanings.definition: A completely different line of thought or action.
meanings.sent1: His tangent about aliens had everyone intrigued.
meanings.sent2: She went off on a tangent about her favorite movie.
meanings.sent3: The meeting took a humorous tangent when someone mentioned unicorns.
meanings.sent4: Their conversation veered off into tangents about parallel universes.
meanings.sent5: The lecture went on tangents exploring various historical events.
